availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Wagers (Estill County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Estill County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Estill County native. Son of James Wages. Married Eliza Park Wagers on September 2, 1858. Father of Jonah Wagers, John W. Wagers, Susan F. Wagers, and Mary B. Wagers. Farmer in Estill County in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in 1850. Served in the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from January 26, 1863 to January 31, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 61B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, Crooked Creek, p. 14.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records on Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058, Estill County Marriages, p. 11.
Kentucky Death Index, 1911-present (Frankfort, KY: Kentucky Department of Information Systems), Volume 13, Certificate 5032.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 372.
